pullRequest.body:
We add a section `Representability` at the end of `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Classifier` where we formalize the necessary lemmas and definitions that lead to the proof of `CategoryTheory.isRepresentable_hasClassifier_iff`, which states that a category `C` has a subobject classifier if and only if the subobjects presheaf `CategoryTheory.Subobject.presheaf C` is representable (Proposition 1 in Section I.3 of Sheaves in Geometry and Logic [MM92]). The toughest part is found in definition `CategoryTheory.Classifier.fromRepresentation`, which formalizes as closely as possible the argument given in [MM92, pp. 33-34].

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Import changes exceeding 2%

| +2.62% | `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Classifier` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Classifier | 610 | 626 | +16 (+2.62%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Topos.Classifier`|16|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ SubobjectRepresentableBy`
`+ arrow_isPullback`
`+ cmap`
`+ cmap_compr`
`+ compr`
`+ compr_cmap`
`+ compr_isPullback`
`+ eqOfIsPullback`
`+ fromRepresentation`
`+ hx_mk`
`+ hx_pullback`
`+ hθ`
`+ hφ`
`+ i`
`+ instance {X : C} (x : Subobject X) : Mono (pullback.snd (t₀ h) (φ h x)) := inferInstance`
`+ isPullback_uniq`
`+ isPullback_φ`
`+ isRepresentable_hasClassifier_iff`
`+ isTerminal_Ω₀`
`+ representableBy`
`+ t₀`
`+ t₀_mono`
`+ Ω₀`
`+ θ`
`+ ι`
`+ π`
`+ φ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
This definition should be split in several separate definitions/lemmas, all taking `h : (Subobject.presheaf C).RepresentableBy Ω` as a variable.
I am currently in the process of doing that, but I wonder if I should make all the definitions `private` to avoid leaking them in the API?
Also this adds quite some noise as I need to inline `h` as an explicit argument everywhere, but maybe in Mathlib style that is preferable to a long proof with local `let` definitions.

A possibility is to add an abbreviation `SubobjectRepresentableBy X :=  (Subobject.presheaf C).RepresentableBy X` and to define everything in the `SubobjectRepresentableBy` namespace. I do not think we need that many private definitions.

I understand how putting things in a separate namespace avoids putting `private` modifiers everywhere, but I don't get the purpose of the `SubobjectRepresentableBy` abbreviation. Is it supposed to help in avoiding explicit mention of `h` when using the various intermediate definitions?
I do not see how having a variable `h` is a problem. Using a namespace permits dot notation, which may contribute having a compact syntax.

I specifically asked about the `SubobjectRepresentableBy` abbreviation, whose purpose I still don't understand.

Regarding the variable `h`, the problem is that I need to pass around `h` explicitly to every use of a definition that depends on it, which I did not need to do in the "inlined" version with local `let` definitions. For instance `φ x` becomes `φ h x`. You can take a look at the code and see for yourself: it works, but it's more verbose than previously, and arguably makes statements harder to read.
By the way I have tried declaring `h` as an implicit variable, but somehow the type inference gets stuck when I do that.
Again: I do not see how having a variable `h` is a problem.

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Topos): add representability results for subobject classifier
